data.title: Pastronomi Sandwich  OH MY MY!!!!
data.text:
Our family went to lunch at Christy's Euro Pub about 3 weeks ago after church on Sunday.  The special is their Pastrami Sandwich; my husband, daughter and son-in-law ordered it and my husband said that this is the "best pastrami sandwich I have ever had."  I got one of their hamburgers and it was delicious!  We ate outside on the porch and luckily no one was smoking, so we could enjoy our lunch.   The waitress was very nice and attentive and actually told us she thrived on being busy.  She did a great job with our experience.'

All in all, we will be back, but please get the pastrami sandwich, it's is the greatest sandwich!!   I liked their frenchfries.

data.title: Brunch
data.text: Good food.  Ambiance ok.  A little dark and dingy inside.  Nice patio area though.  Good selection of pub grub, apps , burgers and breakfast items.  It was very busy so the staff was a little short.

data.title: Horrible customer service
data.text:
I visited my daughter at college a few months ago and we stopped at Christie's for dinner. Although the wait staff was a bit rude and seemed inconvenienced when we sat down, it turned out to be a decent meal. 
We decided to give it a second chance this evening. Granted, they were busy, but there was not excuse for the way we were treated. The bartender ignored us and continued on with the conversation he was having with someone who appeared to be a friend. I asked where we should wait for a table and the waitress replied "not there, you're in the way". The staff was so blatantly nasty to us that we decided to leave before even sitting down. There is no excuse for being unkind.

data.title: Stop searching and just go to Christy's
data.text: I've traveled all over the world but I live in Greenville... Christys is just so original. Truly no place like it. If you're in Greenville you've gotta go... Great customer service, great food. If there's a wait, just wait haha.

data.title: Top 5
data.text: Simply the best of Greenville! Bison sliders, cheese steak, fried pickles, and beer specials! Don't miss this on your next trip to the Pirate Nation!

data.title: One of my favorite local hangouts!
data.text: I'm a Greenville native and have enjoyed every visit at Christy's. Great food, great drinks and always fun. Affordable and laid back atmosphere, away from the busy downtown scene makes it ideal.

data.title: Great lunch spot!
data.text: In a old converted gas station/garage.  Don't let the décor fool you.  This place looks like a dump.  However, you can't beat the food!  Not your typical bar food, although they do have that.  The lunch specials that change daily are where its at.  You will never go wrong with that!

data.title: Best Place to Chill in Greenville
data.text: Christy's is a Greenville institution. It is a great place to drink and unwind and also a pretty good place to get lunch with colleagues as well. Honestly, I wish I went there more.

data.title: Old Standby - neighborhood hang out for residents and students!
data.text: Usually busy, but always welcoming... will definitely see someone you know or wish you did. Old codgers and hipsters alike frequent this place for it's laid-back atmosphere and well-above average bar food! Great after hours for a drink and snack!

data.title: Pub Lover's Dream!
data.text: My son took us here for brunch and it was so good we went again the next day.  The coolest little pub but the best part was the food.  We all had an incredible meal, some brunch and some lunch and everyone was happy.  I highly recommend that you order something with bacon because I have never had bacon that good in my life.  Service was great.  Kitchen is small so you have to wait a while for your food but it is worth it.  Prices reasonable.  Do not miss if you are in Greenville!

data.title: So good... So, So good.
data.text: I love this place. It is a real hidden gem. The food is just incredible. Everything I've tried is even better than the last. Love, Love this place.

data.title: The Food is AMAZING!!!
data.text:
From the outside you would not think that something so good from a place like this. it is small and we had to sit at a table with strangers but they were nice and we talked the entire time.

I had the veggie press with chicken and spicy sweet potato fries. I only ate half of my sandwich and took the rest home. Sometimes leftovers loose their flavor but the other half of my sandwich was just as tasty as the first half. 

I don't live in Greenville but the next time that I am in town visiting family I will return to Christy's.

data.title: Christy's needs to treat customers better.
data.text: The food here is good, atmosphere is nice but can be very cramped most of the time. Christy's is a very small place and they are busy all day. The reason I gave Christy's such a low rating is because every time I have been there I was treated like a lower class customer. It would take forever to get drink orders and food. All because the staff was so worried about keeping their more frequent customers happy. I used to frequently but it's like if they don't know you they completely forget about you. And I tip well too. I have worked in many facets of food service and this place greatly disappointed me. Stop treating your non regular customers like dirt and try to be as equal as possible. If anything the regulars will be more lenient, and the new customers are the ones you should strive to befriend and keep!!

data.title: Maybe it's just me, but I think we should eat with other people...
data.text:
I ate at Christy's twice and ordered take out from them twice more at the end of January and beginning of February, 2016.  I was one of five people and while my companions generally liked the food, I wasn't very impressed at all.

Over the four meals, I ordered:

Euro Goulash -- this is very similar to one of Denny's skillets.  There was nothing special about it, actually.  And why the heck is this even called a goulash?!?  Do they even KNOW what goulash is -- this dish has nothing to do with that name (it's not a soup or stew and doesn't have paprika or veggies or much meat!)...it's like calling a cactus a rose goes they're both plants.  I don't particularly like Denny's but at least they offer the same food at half the price without the silly hype.  Not great.  

Hashbrown Casserole -- this didn't seem very different than the goulash.  I wasn't impressed and wouldn't order it again.

Smokehouse -- it was a decent burger but not great.  In fact, the middle was rather undercooked and made me feel a little queesy later.  The sauce was yummy but the price tag was WAY too high for this region.  I wouldn't order it again.

Gyro -- this was my last attempt to find something I liked.  I think the gyros you can get in a mall are just as tasty for half the price.  Again, not at all impressed.  And not particularly noteworthy either.

Smoked Duck on Ciabatta -- I didn't try this, but two of my dinning companions had this twice each and loved it.  I'm not a fan of duck (I find it too greasy), so I didn't try this myself.

On the bright side, Christy's offers a variety of options other than fries -- tater tots, spicy sweet potato fries, and sweet sweet potato fries.  And they have a number of vegetarian options.  Otherwise, uh, yeah, not much to talk about here other than high prices and a funky atmosphere.

One not on the decor.  Maybe it's cuz I'm not from this part of the country, but I found the restroom signs mildly racist -- "Euro Guys" and "Euro Girls" is a little too close to "no colored people" for me.  8-(

data.title: A Gem
data.text: I had never been here before but loved it.  Great little joint.  Nice staff and great food.  Try the grilled cheese with basil.  Good beer choices as well.

data.title: Hidden treasure!
data.text: I honestly didn't even know Christy's was on Jarvis St until a friend recommended it to me some time last year. I hate that I missed out on such good eats for as long as I did! I have tried several items on the menu along with one they made for me upon request that was not on the menu and have never been disappointed. The food at Christy's is absolutely amazing! The menu has something for everyone and the food is definitely unique in town. The staff is awesome and very accommodating. They always make sure you have a everything you need. I often stop in for lunch and service is quick and haven't had to wait for seating. Definitely a must try!

data.title: Little place big taste
data.text: Have been in Greenville for about six months and nothing I have had from there menus has disappointed me they have daily specials at a great value and some get your mind right mimosas to help start the day or keep you gowing

data.title: A Delicious Dive Bar
data.text: If you stumble across Christy's in the old neighborhood within walking distance to ECU, don't underestimate the appearance of it. Stop in and have a bite to eat or grab a cold drink. The menu is quite eclectic and I've never had a bad meal. I've eaten here for lunch several times with coworkers and each time we've left full and 100% pleased with our meals and service. They have a fantastic looking brunch menu as well and one day I will try one of those dishes.

data.title: Great Local, Hidden Treasure
data.text: This was my second time eating at Christy's Euro Pub in 12 years and I am kicking myself as to why it has been so long. The food was amazing and the atmosphere is what you would expect in a old school college town. Unfortunately Greenville & ECU just don't have that...not like you would expect from a Michigan or Chapel Hill. So it was nice to see that there is an eclectic, seasoned food establishment in Greenville that caters to the college student or the fast passed business professional. That's not east to do.

data.title: A good neighborhood eatery
data.text: Christy's is a good neighborhood pub if you're looking for the college scene, a cold beer and some good bugers or other pub food.
